intro: Drosanthemum hermannii, commonly known as the Hermann's drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Drosanthemum hermannii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water to flourish.
